page.title: 19AREAS OF SPECIAL INTEREST
page.content: {RAINWORTH HEATH}is a conservation area, it is a site of special scientific interest noted under section 28 of the{WILDLIFE AND {COUNTRYSIDE ACT 1981.}The local planning authority is Newark District Council. This area is under development and eventually it will be open to the public.The area contains some of the best remaining areas of wet and dry heathland. The wet heath is developed along the spring line which comes from a layer of the TRIASSIC Bunter Pebble Beds. The community is dominated by dwarf shrubs particularly heather, Calluna Vulgaris , cross leaved heather Erica Terralix and by many grassland rushes. The wet heath is surrounded by extensive areas of dry heath including Erica Cinerea bell heather and sheeps sorrel Rumex Acetosella. {JOHN TODD
